decks.notes: The deck revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It aims to control the game by using powerful control cards like Oblivion Stone, Karn Liberated, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to remove threats from the opponent, while also using Expedition Map, Sylvan Scrying, and Ancient Stirrings to search for key pieces. The deck can stabilize the board with cards like Wurmcoil Engine and Walking Ballista, and finish the game with powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play hexproof creatures and attach powerful auras to them, creating a fast and resilient aggro strategy. By protecting your creatures from targeted removal with hexproof and pumping them up with auras like Ethereal Armor and Rancor, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes removal spells like Path to Exile to deal with any threats that do manage to get in your way.

The concept of this deck is to quickly equip your hexproof creatures with powerful auras to create a formidable threat that your opponent will have a hard time dealing with. By protecting your creatures with auras and Leyline of Sanctity, you can build up a strong board presence and overwhelm your opponent with evasion, lifelink, and other powerful abilities. The deck focuses on deploying a wide array of auras quickly to boost the power of your creatures and close out the game before your opponent can mount a defense.

The deck focuses on control through counterspells, removal, and disruption while also utilizing cards that provide card advantage like Search for Azcanta and Snapcaster Mage. The win condition comes from planeswalkers like Gideon and Jace, as well as land utility with Field of Ruin and Celestial Colonnade. By controlling the board, disrupting the opponent's strategy, and eventually overwhelming them with powerful planeswalkers, the deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents in a game of attrition.

The deck revolves around utilizing Amulet of Vigor to cheat out Primeval Titans and other powerful threats earlier than usual, by exploiting the bounce lands and untap lands synergy. This allows the deck to generate a significant amount of mana and ramp quickly to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and powerful haste abilities. The deck also includes tools like Summoner's Pact and Ancient Stirrings to find key pieces, as well as Engineered Explosives and Dismember for removal and disruption. It aims to assemble its combo pieces and win the game through explosive ramp and overwhelming board presence.

This aggressive Modern deck utilizes the Death's Shadow creature to take advantage of your own life total as a resource, dealing heavy damage to your opponent while keeping control of the board with removal spells and disruptive cards. The deck aims to quickly lower your life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow, while using card advantage and versatility to stay ahead of your opponent's game plan. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and synergy, this deck can overwhelm opponents and secure victories through smart play and efficient card choices.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to enable the Dredge mechanic, which allows cards to be put into the graveyard and then drawn back into the hand. By dredging key cards like Life from the Loam and Stinkweed Imp, the deck can quickly build a board presence with cards like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. The end goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and burn spells like Conflagrate to close out the game.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly to play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and then use cards like Scapeshift and Primeval Titan to trigger Valakut's ability and deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. Other cards like Summoner's Pact, Farseek, and Wood Elves help to accelerate mana production, while Lightning Bolt provides early removal and Thragtusk offers some life gain and board presence. The inclusion of Prismatic Omen ensures all lands count as mountains, maximizing Valakut's potential.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and gaining incremental advantage through card advantage and tempo plays. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while deploying threats such as Geist of Saint Traft and Spell Queller to apply pressure. With efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, along with powerful card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This Mardu Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. It combines efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate with hand disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes powerful token generators like Young Pyromancer and Lingering Souls to create a wide board presence and pressure the opponent. Bedlam Reveler acts as a potent finisher, allowing the player to refill their hand and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent by playing efficient creatures and removal spells. By employing cards like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Liliana of the Veil, the deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building its own board presence. Additionally, the use of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek allows the deck to control the opponent's resources. The deck's mixture of aggression and disruption makes it a difficult matchup for many decks in the format.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana with cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Farseek, while searching for key pieces like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. Once Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle is on the battlefield along with enough Mountains, players can then combo off with cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to deal a massive amount of damage to the opponent's creatures or even directly to their life total. The deck is focused on quickly assembling the combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with a burst of damage in a single turn.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro-Affinity deck is to flood the battlefield with artifact creatures and use various artifact synergies to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager, Cranial Plating, and Steel Overseer, the deck aims to deal damage swiftly and efficiently. The deck also includes both evasion and lifelink abilities to maintain board presence and pressure. With a focus on speed and aggression, this deck seeks to outpace the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources and game plan while applying consistent pressure using efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to disrupt the opponent's mana base and spells, coupled with aggressive creatures like Dark Confidant and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and outvalue them over the long run. With the help of cards like Eldrazi Displacer and Flickerwisp, the deck also has the ability to provide disruption and protection for its own creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's hand using cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate are used to control the board, while planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Liliana of the Veil provide additional value and threat. The deck aims to maintain a balance between disruption, aggression, and removal in order to control the game and come out on top in 1 vs 1 matchups.

The deck focuses on utilizing the cards Death's Shadow, Gurmag Angler, and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to control the board and protect its threats. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage allows for extra value from spells in the graveyard, and the deck's mana base is designed to support the deck's heavy reliance on black mana.
